meanings.definition: To harass or bully someone with persistent demands or criticisms.
meanings.sent1: The older kids hectored the younger ones to give them their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The boss hectored the employees to work overtime without pay.
meanings.sent3: The parrot hectored the cat by imitating its meows, confusing the poor feline.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds hectored the small town, threatening to unleash a downpour.
meanings.sent5: The persistent mosquito hectored the camper all night, buzzing in their ear relentlessly.

meanings.definition: To intimidate or pressure someone with aggressive or forceful tactics.
meanings.sent1: The aggressive salesperson hectored the customer into buying a product they didn't need.
meanings.sent2: The dictator hectored the citizens into submission through fear and threats.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten hectored the dog by pouncing on its tail repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline hectored the procrastinator, urging them to start their work.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind hectored the fragile tent, threatening to blow it away.
